item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Regrettably, the Society of Women Engineers’ Professional General Body meeting with Pratt and Whitney has been cancelled.

item.title: Fall 2024 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Monday, November 25, 2024 (all day) - Course evaluations for the Fall 2024 semester will open on Monday, November 25 and remain available through Wednesday, December 11. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please be sure to complete evaluation surveys for all your courses!
item.author: Students

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: Society of Women Engineers Schedules December Event with Naval Nuclear Lab
item.description: Date: Monday, December 9, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers in the Ellsworth Room on the third floor of the Union for a Professional General Body Meeting with Naval Nuclear Lab! Although an RSVP is not required, it will help determine how much food/merch is brought to the event.
item.author: Students

item.title: Procurement Services to Present Supplier Showcase on December 5
item.description: All faculty, staff, and students involved in Rensselaer’s procurement process are invited to attend this year’s Supplier Showcase, which will be held from 11:00am to 2:00pm on Thursday, December 5 in the Alumni Sports & Recreation Center. Stop by to network with Rensselaer’s key suppliers and the Procurement Services team, get your professional head shot taken, win exciting raffle prizes from the suppliers, check out the photo booth, and enjoy festive refreshments!
item.author: Community

item.title: Kite Bringing Wógligleya/Imákȟaheye (Geometry/Method) Concert to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Friday, December 6, 2024 7:00 PM - Kite’s artistic practice draws from Indigenous Lakȟóta ontologies to consider the possibility of kindred collaboration with technologies such as artificial intelligence. Kite derived this performance’s graphic notation from geometric shapes and symbols of traditional quillwork and beadwork, as well as shapes and symbols that appear in dreams. Discussion and Q+A with the artist follows; advance tickets recommended.
item.author: Community

item.title: Zvi Galil to Discuss Georgia Tech’s Revolutionary Online Program, Future of Online Learning in Higher Education in Joint CS, ECSE Colloquium
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This talk will describe the OMSCS program, how it came about, its first ten years, and what Georgia Tech has learned from the OMSCS experience, as well as discuss the speaker’s vision of the future of higher education with much a larger role for online learning.
item.author: Community

item.title: MIT’s Professor Mei Hong to Speak December 5
item.description: Date: Thursday, December 5, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Attend this event for an insightful presentation by Professor Mei Hong, a renowned expert in Chemistry from MIT, who will present “Deconstructing and Reconstructing Tau by Solid-State NMR” to delve into the intricate details of tau proteins and their role in neurodegenerative diseases. A meet-and-greet lunch will follow the presentation at 1pm.
item.author: Community

item.title: Design Lab Showcase to be Held Wednesday, December 4
item.description: Scheduled to take place from 2:00PM to 5:00PM on Wednesday, December 4 in the DCC Great Hall, the Design Showcase will feature students from multiple engineering disciplines — including Computer & Systems, Electrical, Industrial & Management, Materials and Mechanical Engineering — solving real-world design challenges for industry, entrepreneurs and academic/medical partners.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the Bicentennial Time Capsule Burial Ceremony on December 3!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 1:00 PM - In celebration of Rensselaer’s Bicentennial, all members of the campus community are welcome to attend this Time Capsule Burial Ceremony outside of the ’86 Field side of the Troy Building! The time capsule, which will include letters capturing the spirit of RPI in 2024, will commemorate the Institute’s legacy while giving future generations a snapshot of our vibrant community. Cupcakes to follow!
item.author: Community

item.title: “Leaders in Action” Conversation with Curtis Priem ‘82 Scheduled for December 5
item.description: Date: Thursday, December 5, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - During this session, host Prof. Azita Hirsa and Vice Chair of the Board of Trustees Curtis R. Priem ‘82 will discuss “the value of intellectual curiosity and mentorship through challenging questioning.” Participants will be able to ask relevant questions; refreshments will be served following the session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Session to Highlight Single Course Enrollment Options
item.description:
Date: Friday, December 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., as he reviews the online graduate programs for working professionals and provides course enrollment options to make an immediate impact on one’s work. Participants can also explore courses for developing valuable skills that benefit employee and employer alike.
